intro: Phaeanthus vietnamensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese phaeanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and delicate, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
